title: A Walk Through Autumn
body: The trees have turned a fiery orange and red, and the crisp air makes every walk feel refreshing. Captured a few moments along the trail.

title: Why I Switched to Manual Photography
body: Auto mode served me well for years, but taking full control of the settings has been a game-changer. Here are some early results.

title: No More Coffee After 3PM
body: Cutting back on late afternoon caffeine has done wonders for my sleep. Still love my morning brew though.

title: Quick Weekend Getaway
body: We packed light and hit the road without much of a plan. It turned out to be one of the best weekends we've had in a while.

title: Morning Routine Revisited
body: I've been experimenting with a new morning routine: stretching, journaling, and 15 minutes of reading. So far, so good.

title: First Snowfall of the Season
body: Woke up to a soft white blanket covering everything. Took a few shots before it melted away by noon.

title: Trying Out a New Recipe
body: Made a lentil curry last night from a friend's recommendation. Surprisingly easy and full of flavor.

title: What I'm Reading This Month
body: Diving into a mix of fiction and non-fiction — a sci-fi novel, a biography, and a book on habit formation. Will share thoughts soon.

title: Sunset Over the Lake
body: Sometimes all you need is a quiet spot, good company, and a view like this.

title: Studio Setup Upgrade
body: Finally got around to reorganizing my workspace. New lighting, a better chair, and a second monitor — total game changer.
